greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Position of first occurrence of exactly n consecutive '8's in a row in the decimal expansion of Pi.
comment: Differs from A050287 from a(3) > A050287(3) = A050287(4) = a(4) on. - _M. F. Hasler_, Mar 19 2017
link: Peter Trüb, 22.4 trillion digits of pi
xref: Cf. A000796: Decimal expansion (or digits) of Pi.
First occurrence of exactly n times the same digit: A096755 (exactly n '1's), A096756, A096757, A096758, A096759, A096760, A096761, A096762, A096763 (exactly n '9's), A050279 (exactly n '0's).
First occurrence of n times the same digit: A035117 (n '1's), A050281 (n '2's), A050282, A050283, A050284, A050286, A050287, A048940 (n '9's).
First occurrence of concatenate(1,...,n): A121280 = A068987 - 1.
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 07 2004
ext: a(8) via SubIdiom.com/pi search engine from _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 13 2019
